page.title: 07HISTORY (Cont'd)
page.content: The 19th and early 20th centuries saw attempts at establishing the weaving of linen in the area with several local mills being built. These were shortlived and agriculture and fishing remained the way of life. In 1856 a National School was opened in Ballymacrickett and was in use till 1937 when a new school was built. This was improved and extended in 1969, and no longer did children come to school with a few lumps of turf to provide heat! The original church in Ballymacrickett dates from 1760, a new building being erected in 1802: the present day church (St,Joseph's) dates from 1868.
